citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A black and white striped hen was observed to be limping on her left leg. The leg appears to be swollen and to be rotated
with the toes pointing outward. The abnormal appearance of the leg indicates that there was possibly a previous injury or
infection and no veterinary care has been provided to evaluate the bird's leg. Untreated injuries or infections can be
painful and affect the well-being of the animal. The chicken must be evaluated by the Attending Veterinarian and any
prescribed treatments must be followed. Correct by September 15, 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The licensee has not developed and documented an environmental enhancement plan to promote the psychological well-
being of the birds housed at the facility. Lack of an environmental enhancement plan does not ensure that adequate and
appropriate measures to promote the psychological well-being of the birds are being provided. The licensee must
develop, document and follow an environmental enhancement plan that promotes the psychological well-being of the
birds. The plan must also be approved by the Attending Veterinarian. Correct by: September 30, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A black and white striped hen was observed to be limping on her left leg. The leg appears to be swollen and to be rotated 
with the toes pointing outward. The abnormal appearance of the leg indicates that there was possibly a previous injury or 
infection and no veterinary care has been provided to evaluate the bird's leg. Untreated injuries or infections can be 
painful and affect the well-being of the animal. The chicken must be evaluated by the Attending Veterinarian and any 
prescribed treatments must be followed. Correct by September 15, 2023. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The licensee has not developed and documented an environmental enhancement plan to promote the psychological well- 
being of the birds housed at the facility. Lack of an environmental enhancement plan does not ensure that adequate and 
appropriate measures to promote the psychological well-being of the birds are being provided. The licensee must 
develop, document and follow an environmental enhancement plan that promotes the psychological well-being of the 
birds. The plan must also be approved by the Attending Veterinarian. Correct by: September 30, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
